And here's a wee snapshot. I believe Robert's saying, "You swore blind that this was a fancy dress party!"

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hi Stag
The AA build looks good, and will serve it's purpose well.

I only see minor possible tweaks here.
You know that you can gain one BAB by going Monk 8 Wizard 2 AA10 pre epic?
That also allows you to have a later spellcraft dump by taking the last level of wizard at lvl 20 for spellcraft 23 (25). You will lose that AB if you cut down on AA levels, so you have to aim for no more than monk 11. AA 29 is available too, if you can live with monk 9 and a single monk level for a late tumble dump. But more dumps are easier to play.
Unless you plan on going toe to toe, you will live well without discipline.
An earlier wiz level will let you use wizard items and scrolls earlier, but will delay BAB progression some and interfere with your (first) spellcraft dump.

Good luck with your pointy-eared adventure!

Edit: Forgot to mention that i usually take rapid shot early, before finesse and blind fight, to be able to "spam" two arrows per round when the character only has one attack per round. I usually start with PBS, just like you do.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
The main problem going with monk instead of rogue for AA is no Uncanny Dodge (or in Wulgar's case... Def Awareness).  That could (no... will!) come back to bite you since most all your AC is based on DEX.  At least with that wiz level you'll be able to cast short-term Darkness by scroll to avoid that problem but even that will get old after a while of spending gold for such limited defense duration (dunno how tight Aielund is with gold, maybe not a problem).  The other issue is how little monk adds to the build except vs. reflex saves which a rogue would provide anyway (UNLESS LIMITED TO ROBES).  All the melee feats (Cleave, KD/IKD) would be predicated on fighting in robes to get the monk bonuses (WIS AC, monk AC, monk speed, monk progression) so those monk levels main purpose ends up producing unbreachable SR 22.  Nice granted, but worth 12 levels?   Which brings me to utter confusion...

I'm trying to read your stats and anticipate how this will be played but coming up blank.  In robes?  In plate?  Sometime one, sometimes the other?  Can't figure it.

If you pull like a typical archer would, you'll either be already wearing plate which will reduce your AC significantly and negate all monk bonuses or be wearing robes in all situations and end up in PBS because you won't be able to switch to plate after the first shot.  But then why all this finessing business?  Sry, mate, I'm lost.

Oh, and like Empyre said, lose the lame longsword.  It has no relevance at all other than standing there looking as if you'd actually try to use it for intimidation value perhaps.  Also, that kama will not deliver monk progression (or any other monk bonus for that matter) while in your melee plate (and/or shield) so may as well go with a dagger or something if that's what was planned.  At least you'd get some better crit chance.

This is a great example of why it is so important to choose a solid tertiary class.  You are going to be needing at least 9 levels of so it better contribute lots of value to the goal.  And that is what I am having a hard time discerning.

edit:  Hey, Stagmeister... check out Cin's Singing Sniper (Brb 5/Brd 6/ AA29) in the legacy archive.  It's well off the beaten path (which is at least partially what you are looking for it seems), gets off the ground fast and contains lots and lots of perks.  It is a dedicated AA, though, just so you know ahead of time what to expect.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Monk is chosen for AA builds primarily because of the speed bonus. They are usually played as run'n gun archers. If you play in a party, you often have time to just stand and shoot, but not always. If some of the bad guys come after you, running and shooting can also serve as a means to divert some of the pressure that is on the meat shield.
But monk is not only about speed. Monk serves well as tumble class and grants evasion and improved evasion. Monk also has better AC than other high-dexers, in part because of the extra AC you get every 5th level, but even more because of the extra AC you get when you add to wisdom from items or spells.
Monk also has better saves than the alternative classes, with 3 primary saving throws and the still mind feat. Immunity to poison and disease is also a nice bonus.
Lack of uncanny dodge is a problem with monks in general, but a run'n gun archer seems to do well without it.

Spoiler [+]

Get the boots of travelling from the clothes merchant in Bracksford asap. They grant permanent "expeditious retreat" speed and will boost your monk speed! They will also improve the speed of your entire party.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:
Monk is chosen for AA builds primarily because of the speed bonus. They are usually played as run'n gun archers. .... etc.

Yeah, I understand the theory, Mick.  What I'm questioning is the practicality compared to a roguish one or any tertiary that can avoid the problem of getting flanked when the meatshields are not close at hand or locked up with their own immdiate issues. 

Rogue will address at least two of the most impactful concerns:  damage via sneaks and AC stability via UD.  The benefit of monk's reflex saves feat (mainly avoiding evoc spell damage) is a wash because rogue gets the same feat albeit 1 level later and monk does nothing to augment the damage issue.

The moment that monk swaps out to kama the AB and damage drops by 15 (or however many AA levels/2) which ends up a worse scenario in every situation because, AoOs aside, the longer any toon stands and misses and does puny damage when it does manage to hit something, the more incoming crits must be dealt with.  The monk progression will just not make up for the vast handicap a melee switch provides.   Having the arsenal of all divine scrolls at one's finger tips, though, is a huge advantage, especially scrolls of Death Ward, Spell Resist and occasionally Magic Vest.

So, yeah, there are some "nice" bonuses to a monk tertiary, just not anywhere near as many as a rogue would provide. 

@Stagmeister:  Sorry 'ol chum, but that +2 piercing damage per hit becomes insignificant with a high level AA and should not determine effectiveness.  It's nice if it can be managed, but not necessary.  If it becomes a focal point, build a divine power AA. That solves the entire mighty issue easily.  But thanks for at least resolving the armor confusion.  I've seen CHA AA builds that revolved around shooting in heavy plate but those were essentially PBS builds that did not use extensive artillery methods and sucked trying to avoid AoOs.  Cin's barb AA can rage twice a day to make up for that bit of mighty loss, if necessary, but it never is.  The barb speed, however, does lend itself to the sniper technique and is not negated by gear as a monk's speed would be.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
HipRedux wrote:
Yeah, I understand the theory, Mick.  What I'm questioning is the practicality compared to a roguish one or any tertiary that can avoid the problem of getting flanked when the meatshields are not close at hand or locked up with their own immdiate issues. 
 
A monk archer and a rogue archer are very different species. Rogues have UD, SA and UMD. Monks have speed, better AC and better saves. Both have an arcane caster class that can use scrolls and other class items. Monk doesn't need UMD to equip those monk boots and robes and whatnot.
Run'n gun involves a lot of running. Speed makes crowd control possible by keeping distance, shooting, keeping distance, shooting etc. Melee is not a good option, period. If you are forced to melee you will need discipline and finesse. You have KD and can use gloves or kamas with a sub par AB (no WF or EWF). But a monk archer is a ranged specialist and is built to to be able to keep the distance for crowd control.

I've had a thought on the Discipline issue - I'm sure you'll let me know if it's a stupid one. Rather than thinking which skills I could use instead of Disc, what if I dropped INT down to 12 and simply lost the 40 SPs? The 2 points could be added to WIS at creation, giving that stat a +1 and therefore +1 to AC and the Will save (as well as adding 1 to, iirc, Heal and Spot). Admittedly, I'd need 1 more point in Spellcraft, which would have to be cross-classed, but given that I'd have 3 to play with, I'd still have 1 spare (to raise Heal to a mighty 2). Worth it?

Also, I might - at a pinch - be prepared to drop STR to 10 or 12, much as it goes against my better nature, which could either boost CON by 2 (for HPs and Fort) if 10, or WIS again if 12 or 10 (again for AC and Will - possibly even Zen Archery, but I don't know much about that feat, except it doesn't count for AA bonuses). Or even more DEX (which would involve dropping Epic Prowess for another GDex so as not to end on an odd number).

Dagnabbit - you see what happens when choices present themselves?!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote:
Oh, and my Monkly AA is belting around like a scalded cat on speed currently
 
If you really want to take this to the extreme - I mean EXTREME...
Spoiler [+]

Get a wand of Expeditious retreat and cast several times on your monk. The speed effect will stack! It will leave any scalded cat (on speed or not) behind, like a turtle stuck in syrup.
Regrettably you cannot craft an ER wand with the craft wand feat. But if you want to test it: Go to the toolset and put one in a container, or visit a trainer mod where you can customize item properties and make an item with unlimited ER castings per day!
The standard toolset ER is only level 5 and lasts only 5 rounds, but you can "refuel" whenever you want, and what a distance you cover in 5 rounds!
I know it is cheating, but...   you have not lived a full and satisfying life without trying.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Ah, Mick...once again tempting me down a path of naughtiness . Thanks! Am currently on the Isle of the Dead in Aielund with Sir William and Ronan, not far from levelling to 17 and playing tag with Abyssal Spectres. Have been swapping footwear depending on the environment - need to really get something else that gives haste, to enable full Speedy Gonzalez and keep my Sun Soul booties on.

Regardless, thanks for the tip!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
All right, I've taken this build across Aielund, and had a thoroughly great time doing it. However, I'm reluctant to shift it to the Full Epic forum. I, albeit reluctantly, have to admit that Rogue would have been a better tertiary class for what I was hoping to do (if I hear an "I told you so" even whispered from Hip I shall be most vexed). I made very little use of my stealth skills, and, given they took up two maxed skills, that's an awful lot of wasted skill points.

I did, however, get an insight into a different way of playing: Mick's aforementioned gun'n run. That worked really, really well, but it's a sod if you're both travelling with companions and give a shit about them - because they will die. Quite a lot.

I'm pleased I gave it a go, and that I succeeded in my test-run. There's probably a better version out there somewhere, but it's the first time I've actually finished a campaign with a shootist, so do give her a try if you fancy trying something different. She's not a bad build, but she's a long way from optimized.

Thanks to all for contributions
